text.__SUMMARY__: Nectria radicicola is a plant pathogen that is the causal agent of root rot. Substrates include ginseng and Narcissus. It is also implicated in the black foot disease of grapevine.
text.Bibliography: Boerema, G. H.; Hamers, Maria E. C. (May 1989). "Check-list for scientific names of common parasitic fungi. Series 3b: Fungi on bulbs: Amaryllidaceae and Iridaceae". Netherlands Journal of Plant Pathology. 95 (S3): 1–29. doi:10.1007/BF01981520.
